website_summaries.verdict: A highly configurable laptop that starts at an affordable price.
pros: Features a powerful Intel i7 processor
Comes with an SSD in 512GB or 1TB sizes
Customers praise the feel of the keyboard and the overall construction quality
cons: The 14-inch screen is on the smaller size for video and photo editing

customer_reviews.title: Great! ...while it worked.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was the best PC laptop out there so I went ahead and bought it. This was less than a month ago and it worked great, but two days ago it just wouldn't turn on. Tried all troubleshooting tips from Lenovo and did not solved the issue. Seller did not provide support at all and refered me to Lenovo. I was forced to go back to my old Lenovo which is still working like a charm. BEWARE! In summary, I lost all my work, wasted time and money. Now I need to return this and get a decent one.
customer_reviews.author: Jose D. Leiva

customer_reviews.title: Lookout, nits are not advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is the fhd touch 300 nits screen. Seems like a odd config, even on lenovo site its a hard config to even make.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Alter

customer_reviews.title: Battery issues - would not purchase this model
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this computer six months yet and the computer shuts down on its own and the power button blinks. If the machine isn't plugged in it shuts down and it won't start even with a full battery charge; the machine will shut down. I am beyond disappointed. This is NOT a cheap machine. Now here I am having to send it back for repairs and using insurance I had to pay for. I am without a computer to do my work. This is NOT fair.
customer_reviews.author: April Blair

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: The wife & I both use this laptop for college almost exclusively, & it's worked like a charm since we got it 3 weeks ago! I have no complaints about this laptop, as it has worked very well every day that we have used it. Would recommend to any student or home user that is looking for a solid laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Laptop!
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from an old Yoga machine. While this machine does not flip to tablet mode, I find that I dont really miss it. I LOVE the anti-glare screen, great sound, fast as lightening, and the Lenovo keyboard simply cannot be bead. Overall, I really like the Thinkpad X-1 Carbon.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Flat out shuts down randomly
customer_reviews.text: Flat out shuts down randomly all the time, after searching the web, apparently this is a common problem that lenovo doesn't support very well. What a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Hondivad

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I’m writing another review. The problem with my speakers was resolved but now I have a serious problem. My computer will not come on. Ive tried the reset and nothing happened!!! I work from home and have missed two days of work!!! Not happy
customer_reviews.author: Dianepetra

customer_reviews.title: Known Defects -- You may end up shipping it right back to them
customer_reviews.text: When you pay for a premium ultra book, you're not looking to send it in for repairs within the first six months. All brands have 'lemon' units -- that's understandable. Still shakes your confidence in the brand. Customer service was mediocre -- took too long for repairs, especially when you do everything via Zoom and can't afford the delay. I wouldn't buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Mal117Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor battery life, poor construction quality
customer_reviews.text: Within a few months of purchase, the battery life became very poor. Two to three hours on a full charge is the maximum I'm seeing. Overall construction quality looks cheap. The laptop also gets heated up quickly. For a laptop that was touted as one of the top offerings, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: SammyR

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after a month.
customer_reviews.text: I never post reviews but this computer stopped working a month after I purchased it. even plugged in for hours. it is not reliable. you should avoid purchasing it. prior to this I was a big fan of ThinkPad. but his has severely underperformed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stable performance
customer_reviews.text: There is a big problem with heat dissipation, often reaching 80 °C,176 degrees Fahrenheit.
customer_reviews.author: laduo

customer_reviews.title: The best!!
customer_reviews.text: A fabulous machine! Even better... This exact model is $1499 at Costco.
customer_reviews.author: David Moore

customer_reviews.title: Decided on the X1 Carbon
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice laptop. Purchased this same machine from Costco on sale for $1299. This laptop is VERY light and I'm saying that as my other laptop is a Microsoft Surface Pro 6 which is a tablet-based PC w/keyboard. Also, this laptop is fast. Still looking at testing the battery life. I was wanted to go back to Lenovo for their world-class keyboard. Bar-none, the best.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Junk...  And Service is Worse!
customer_reviews.text: What a horrible experience. Nearly a 1600 Dollar Laptop computer and Service from Lenovo is some of the absolute worst I have ever experienced in my life. This computer makes a horrible paperweight and its far more expensive than an old rock from outside which is about all this thing is anymore. Support Claims Hard Drive Failed, when a new one is replaced into it (mind you all the data on the system is lost) they now claim to not know what is wrong and I am out a computer for an unknown period of time. Considered buying other Lenovo Products for my business until this experience happened.
customer_reviews.author: TMR
